unnormalised: ## Ditch Netflix, Hit a Film Festival! (And maybe spot SRK?)
normalised: ## Ditch Netflix, Hit a Film Festival! (And maybe spot S R K?)

unnormalised: Okay, so you're scrolling through Netflix *again*, can't find anything, feeling that existential dread of choice? I get it. Been there, done that. But hear me out: ditch the algorithm and dive into the real world of film – film festivals!
normalised: Okay, so you're scrolling through Netflix *again*, can't find anything, feeling that existential dread of choice? I get it. Been there, done that. But hear me out: ditch the algorithm and dive into the real world of film – film festivals!

unnormalised: Seriously, folks, film festivals are where it's at. They’re not just for "arty" types or filmmakers trying to make it big. (Though, you might spot some!) They’re for anyone who loves a good story and wants to see something *different*. Think of it as a curated cinematic adventure.
normalised: Seriously, folks, film festivals are where it's at. They’re not just for "arty" types or filmmakers trying to make it big. (Though, you might spot some!) They’re for anyone who loves a good story and wants to see something *different*. Think of it as a curated cinematic adventure.

unnormalised: India's got a bunch of amazing ones. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is HUGE. I'm talking massive screenings, panel discussions, and maybe, just maybe, you'll catch a glimpse of Shah Rukh Khan walking the red carpet. It's like a Bollywood dream come true, right? But there are smaller, more niche festivals too, focusing on documentaries, short films, or regional cinema. The advantage of these is that they offer an intimate experience, and you could probably bump into the director and have a chat!

unnormalised: Why bother, you ask? Well, for starters, you'll see films you'd *never* find on your streaming service. We're talking indie gems, foreign flicks that will blow your mind, and documentaries that will make you think. Plus, film festivals are a total vibe. Meeting fellow film buffs, discussing movies over chai (Rs. 20 a cup near the venue, usually!), and experiencing the energy of a creative community... it's addictive.

unnormalised: Last year, I saw a film about a farmer in Vidarbha struggling with debt, and honestly, it stuck with me way more than any blockbuster. It even inspired me to donate Rs. 500 to a farmers' relief fund! See? Movies can change the world (and your perspective).
normalised: Last year, I saw a film about a farmer in Vidarbha struggling with debt, and honestly, it stuck with me way more than any blockbuster. It even inspired me to donate rupees five hundred to a farmers' relief fund! See? Movies can change the world (and your perspective).

unnormalised: So, ditch the auto-playing trailers, check out what festivals are happening near you (Google "film festivals India" – it's that easy!), and get ready for a cinematic adventure. You might even discover your new favorite director... or at least have a killer story to tell at your next family gathering. Trust me, you won't regret it. Maybe I'll even see you there! I’ll be the one arguing about the proper way to make masala chai, approx. 5 km from the main stage.
